publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-7281 Aileen Campbell: First Cardinal for Zambia—That the Parliament congratulates Archbishop Medardo Mazombwe, the retired archbishop of Lusaka, Zambia, on being appointed as a cardinal of the Catholic Church by Pope Benedict XVI; notes that Archbishop Mazombwe is the first Zambian to be made a cardinal, and considers that this is a great honour both for the Archbishop and the country; understands that Archbishop Mazombwe was a strong advocate for the cancellation of international debt during the Jubilee 2000 campaign, and hopes that he and his fellow cardinals will use their positions to champion causes of peace and justice around the world. Supported by: Anne McLaughlin*, Elaine Smith*, Bob Doris*, Bill Kidd*
S3M-7281 First Cardinal for Zambia (lodged on 27 October 2010) Stuart McMillan*, Des McNulty*, Jamie Hepburn*, Gil Paterson*
